This is for a 2-hour tutorial with 25 students..." style="width: 100%; padding: 12px; border: 2px solid #2D2D4A; border-radius: 6px; font-family: inherit; font-size: 1rem; min-height: 80px; box-sizing: border-box; background: #16162A; color: #E2E8F0;" oninput="updatePromptPreview()"></textarea>

<script>
(function() {
  var experienceId = 'teaching-with-ai';
  var TOTAL_STEPS = 6;
  var STORAGE_KEY = 'ai-passport-steps-teaching-with-ai';
  var urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search);
  var uid = urlParams.get('uid') || 'anonymous';

  // Step names for progress bar
  var stepNames = ['', 'Welcome', 'RTCF', 'Prompt Lab', 'Techniques', 'Library', 'Wrap Up'];

  // ---- Step state ----
  var currentStep = 1;
  var highestCompleted = 0;

  function loadStepProgress() {
    try {
      var saved = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY) || '{}');
      highestCompleted = saved.highestCompleted || 0;
      currentStep = saved.currentStep || 1;
      if (currentStep > highestCompleted + 1) currentStep = highestCompleted + 1;
    } catch (e) {
      highestCompleted = 0;
      currentStep = 1;
    }
  }

  function saveStepProgress() {
    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify({
      highestCompleted: highestCompleted,
      currentStep: currentStep
    }));
  }

  // ---- Progress bar rendering ----
  function renderProgressBar() {
    var bar = document.getElementById('progress-bar');
    var html = '';

    for (var i = 1; i <= TOTAL_STEPS; i++) {
      var isCompleted = i <= highestCompleted;
      var isCurrent = i === currentStep;
      var isLocked = i > highestCompleted + 1;

      // Connector line (before each step except the first)
      if (i > 1) {
        html += '<div style="flex: 1; max-width: 40px; height: 2px; background: ' +
          (i <= highestCompleted + 1 ? '#4F46E5' : '#2D2D4A') +
          '; align-self: center;"></div>';
      }

      // Step circle
      var bg, color, border, cursor, opacity;
      if (isCurrent) {
        bg = '#4F46E5'; color = 'white'; border = '2px solid #7C3AED'; cursor = 'default'; opacity = '1';
      } else if (isCompleted) {
        bg = '#0D2818'; color = '#22C55E'; border = '2px solid #22C55E'; cursor = 'pointer'; opacity = '1';
      } else {
        bg = '#1E1E36'; color = '#64748B'; border = '2px solid #2D2D4A'; cursor = 'default'; opacity = '0.5';
      }

      var clickHandler = isCompleted ? 'onclick="goToStep(' + i + ')"' : '';
      var title = isLocked ? 'Complete previous steps first' : stepNames[i];

      html += '<div ' + clickHandler + ' title="' + title + '" style="' +
        'width: 36px; height: 36px; border-radius: 50%; display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; ' +
        'font-size: 13px; font-weight: bold; flex-shrink: 0; transition: all 0.2s; ' +
        'background: ' + bg + '; color: ' + color + '; border: ' + border + '; cursor: ' + cursor + '; opacity: ' + opacity + ';">' +
        (isCompleted && !isCurrent ? '&#10003;' : i) + '</div>';
    }

    bar.innerHTML = html;
  }

  // ---- Step navigation ----
  function showStep(step) {
    // Hide all steps
    var allSteps = document.querySelectorAll('.exp-step');
    for (var s = 0; s < allSteps.length; s++) {
      allSteps[s].style.display = 'none';
    }

    // Show the target step
    var target = document.querySelector('.exp-step[data-step="' + step + '"]');
    if (target) {
      target.style.display = 'block';
    }

    currentStep = step;

    // Mark previous step as completed (if moving forward)
    if (step - 1 > highestCompleted) {
      highestCompleted = step - 1;
    }

    saveStepProgress();
    renderProgressBar();

    // Scroll to top of the experience
    document.getElementById('experience-app').scrollIntoView({ behavior: 'smooth', block: 'start' });
  }

  // Expose globally for onclick handlers
  window.goToStep = function(step) {
    if (step >= 1 && step <= TOTAL_STEPS && step <= highestCompleted + 2) {
      showStep(step);
    }
  };

  // ---- RTCF Example Display ----
  var currentRTCFRole = 'teaching';

  var rtcfExamples = {
    teaching: {
      vague: {
        prompt: '"Help me make a rubric for my class."',
        explanation: 'This prompt lacks specificity. AI doesn\'t know what class, what assessment, what criteria matter, or how detailed you want the rubric.'
      },
      rtcf: '<strong style="color: #F87171;">Role:</strong> You are an experienced curriculum designer who specialises in outcome-based assessment.\n\n<strong style="color: #FBBF24;">Task:</strong> Create a rubric for assessing critical thinking in student essays.\n\n<strong style="color: #4ADE80;">Context:</strong> This is for a second-year marketing strategy unit. Students write 2000-word case analyses. The rubric is worth 30% of their grade. The cohort includes many international students.\n\n<strong style="color: #818CF8;">Format:</strong> 4-point scale (Excellent, Good, Developing, Beginning) with clear descriptors for each level. Table format that can be pasted into Word.',
      result: 'The result? A rubric you can actually use, not a generic template you\'ll spend an hour customising.'
    },
    research: {
      vague: {
        prompt: '"Help me with my literature review."',
        explanation: 'AI doesn\'t know your research question, which papers you\'re working with, what kind of synthesis you need, or how far along you are.'
      },
      rtcf: '<strong style="color: #F87171;">Role:</strong> You are a research methodologist who specialises in systematic literature reviews in the social sciences.\n\n<strong style="color: #FBBF24;">Task:</strong> Synthesise the following five paper summaries into a coherent narrative that identifies themes, agreements, and gaps.\n\n<strong style="color: #4ADE80;">Context:</strong> I\'m writing a literature review for a journal article on AI adoption in higher education marketing. My research question is: How are marketing educators integrating AI tools into assessment design?\n\n<strong style="color: #818CF8;">Format:</strong> A 500-word synthesis narrative organised by theme (not paper-by-paper). End with a paragraph identifying gaps my study could address.',
      result: 'The result? A structured synthesis you can build on, not a generic summary that reads like an annotated bibliography.'
    },
    admin: {
      vague: {
        prompt: '"Write an email about the new policy."',
        explanation: 'AI doesn\'t know which policy, who the audience is, what tone is appropriate, or what action you need people to take.'
      },
      rtcf: '<strong style="color: #F87171;">Role:</strong> You are a professional university communications specialist who writes clear, approachable messages.\n\n<strong style="color: #FBBF24;">Task:</strong> Draft an email announcing the new AI acceptable-use policy to all school staff.\n\n<strong style="color: #4ADE80;">Context:</strong> The policy was approved last week by the Head of School. Staff are anxious about AI restrictions. The tone should be reassuring. The policy enables AI use, it doesn\'t ban it. Some staff have never used AI.\n\n<strong style="color: #818CF8;">Format:</strong> Under 250 words. Include a brief summary of what the policy allows, one clear call to action (read the full policy), and a contact for questions.',
      result: 'The result? A message that lands well with anxious staff, not a bureaucratic wall of text nobody reads.'
    }
  };

  window.setRTCFRole = function(role) {
    currentRTCFRole = role;
    ['teaching', 'research', 'admin'].forEach(function(r) {
      var tab = document.getElementById('rtcf-tab-' + r);
      if (r === role) {
        tab.style.background = '#4F46E5';
        tab.style.color = 'white';
      } else {
        tab.style.background = '#1E1E36';
        tab.style.color = '#64748B';
      }
    });
    document.getElementById('rtcf-example-display').innerHTML = '<p style="color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic; margin: 0;">Click a button above to compare prompts...</p>';
  };

  window.showRTCFExample = function(type) {
    var display = document.getElementById('rtcf-example-display');
    var example = rtcfExamples[currentRTCFRole];

    if (type === 'vague') {
      display.innerHTML = '<p style="margin: 0 0 10px 0; color: #F87171; font-weight: bold;">Vague Prompt:</p><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; color: #CBD5E1;">' + example.vague.prompt + '</p><p style="margin: 15px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;">' + example.vague.explanation + '</p>';
    } else if (type === 'rtcf') {
      display.innerHTML = '<p style="margin: 0 0 10px 0; color: #4ADE80; font-weight: bold;">RTCF Prompt:</p><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #CBD5E1; white-space: pre-wrap;">' + example.rtcf + '</p>';
    } else if (type === 'result') {
      display.innerHTML = '<p style="margin: 0 0 10px 0; color: #C7D2FE; font-weight: bold;">Why the RTCF Version Works:</p><ul style="margin: 0; color: #CBD5E1; line-height: 1.8;"><li><strong>Role</strong> primes AI with relevant expertise and perspective</li><li><strong>Task</strong> is specific and actionable. AI knows exactly what to produce</li><li><strong>Context</strong> provides the constraints and audience info AI needs</li><li><strong>Format</strong> ensures output is immediately usable</li></ul><p style="margin: 15px 0 0 0; color: #94A3B8;">' + example.result + '</p>';
    }
  };

  // ---- Prompt Preview Builder ----
  window.updatePromptPreview = function() {
    var role = document.getElementById('rtcf-role').value;
    var task = document.getElementById('rtcf-task').value;
    var context = document.getElementById('rtcf-context').value;
    var format = document.getElementById('rtcf-format').value;

    var preview = '';
    if (role) preview += role + '\n\n';
    if (task) preview += task + '\n\n';
    if (context) preview += 'Context:\n' + context + '\n\n';
    if (format) preview += 'Format: ' + format;

    var previewEl = document.getElementById('prompt-preview');
    previewEl.textContent = preview || 'Fill in the fields above to build your prompt...';
  };

  window.copyPrompt = function() {
    var preview = document.getElementById('prompt-preview').textContent;
    navigator.clipboard.writeText(preview).then(function() {
      alert('Prompt copied to clipboard!');
    });
  };

  window.loadTemplate = function(type) {
    var templates = {
      lecture: {
        role: 'You are an expert educator who creates engaging, interactive lectures.',
        task: 'Create a 50-minute lecture outline on [TOPIC].',
        context: 'Course: [COURSE NAME]\nLevel: [YEAR LEVEL]\nClass size: [NUMBER] students\nPrevious week covered: [TOPIC]',
        format: 'Structured outline with timing, activities, and discussion prompts for each section.'
      },
      quiz: {
        role: 'You are an assessment specialist who creates questions testing understanding, not just recall.',
        task: 'Create 10 multiple-choice questions on [TOPIC] at varying Bloom\'s taxonomy levels.',
        context: 'Unit: [UNIT NAME]\nStudents have completed: [READINGS/TOPICS]\nThis quiz is formative / summative (choose one)',
        format: 'For each question: stem, 4 options, correct answer, brief explanation, and Bloom\'s level.'
      },
      feedback: {
        role: 'You are a supportive but rigorous academic who helps students improve their work.',
        task: 'Provide developmental feedback on the following student submission.',
        context: 'Assignment: [ASSIGNMENT TYPE]\nMarking criteria: [KEY CRITERIA]\nStudent level: [YEAR]',
        format: 'Start with strengths, then areas for improvement with specific suggestions, end with encouragement.'
      },
      rubric: {
        role: 'You are a curriculum designer specialising in criterion-referenced assessment.',
        task: 'Create an assessment rubric for [ASSIGNMENT TYPE].',
        context: 'Unit: [UNIT NAME]\nLearning outcomes being assessed: [LIST]\nWeighting: [%] of final grade\nSubmission format: [TYPE]',
        format: '4-point scale (Excellent/Good/Developing/Beginning) in table format with clear, observable descriptors.'
      },
      litreview: {
        role: 'You are a research methodologist who specialises in systematic literature reviews.',
        task: 'Synthesise the following paper summaries into a coherent narrative identifying themes, agreements, and gaps.',
        context: 'Research question: [YOUR RQ]\nField: [DISCIPLINE]\nNumber of papers: [N]\nI will paste summaries below.\n\n[PASTE PAPER SUMMARIES]',
        format: 'A 500-word synthesis narrative organised by theme (not paper-by-paper). End with a paragraph identifying gaps.'
      },
      methodology: {
        role: 'You are a rigorous journal reviewer (Reviewer 2 on a bad day).',
        task: 'Critique the following methodology section and identify weaknesses before I submit.',
        context: 'Paper topic: [TOPIC]\nTarget journal: [JOURNAL]\nMethodology: [QUAL/QUANT/MIXED]\n\n[PASTE METHODOLOGY SECTION]',
        format: 'Numbered list of issues, each with: the problem, why it matters, and a specific suggestion for improvement.'
      },
      email: {
        role: 'You are a professional university communications specialist who writes clear, approachable messages.',
        task: 'Draft an email about [TOPIC/SITUATION].',
        context: 'Audience: [WHO]\nPurpose: [WHAT YOU WANT TO ACHIEVE]\nTone: Professional but approachable\nSensitivities: [NOTE ANY]',
        format: 'Under 200 words. Include a clear call to action. Provide two versions: one more formal, one warmer.'
      },
      meeting: {
        role: 'You are a strategic adviser who helps people prepare for high-stakes meetings.',
        task: 'Help me prepare for a meeting about [TOPIC/PROPOSAL].',
        context: 'Attendees: [WHO WILL BE THERE]\nMy goal: [WHAT I WANT TO ACHIEVE]\nPotential concerns: [ANY KNOWN ISSUES]\nTime allocated: [DURATION]',
        format: 'Provide: (1) likely questions from each attendee, (2) potential objections, (3) suggested talking points, (4) a recommended framing for my opening.'
      }
    };

    var template = templates[type];
    document.getElementById('rtcf-role').value = template.role;
    document.getElementById('rtcf-task').value = template.task;
    document.getElementById('rtcf-context').value = template.context;
    document.getElementById('rtcf-format').value = template.format;
    updatePromptPreview();
  };

  // ---- Technique Display ----
  window.showTechnique = function(technique) {
    var detail = document.getElementById('technique-detail');
    var titleEl = document.getElementById('technique-title');
    var contentEl = document.getElementById('technique-content');

    var techniques = {
      board: {
        title: 'Board of Directors Prompting',
        content: '<p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Purpose:</strong> Get multiple perspectives on any decision, plan, or document.</p><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>When to use:</strong> Planning projects, making strategic decisions, reviewing documents before finalizing, understanding stakeholder concerns.</p><div style="background: #16162A; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #e2e8f0; white-space: pre-wrap;">I have [document/plan/decision].\n\nPlease analyse this from the perspectives of:\n- A [stakeholder 1]\n- A [stakeholder 2]\n- A [stakeholder 3]\n- A [stakeholder 4]\n\nFor each perspective, identify:\n1. Their primary concerns\n2. What they would want changed\n3. How they would evaluate success</p></div><p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;"><strong>Tip:</strong> Choose stakeholders with genuinely different interests, not just different job titles.</p>'
      },
      devil: {
        title: 'Devil\'s Advocate',
        content: '<p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Purpose:</strong> Stress-test your own thinking, plans, or decisions.</p><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>When to use:</strong> Before finalizing major decisions, when you suspect you\'re overlooking something, to prepare for objections.</p><div style="background: #16162A; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #e2e8f0; white-space: pre-wrap;">I believe [your position/plan/decision].\n\nPlease argue against this as strongly as possible.\nIdentify:\n1. The weakest parts of my reasoning\n2. Counterarguments I haven\'t considered\n3. Scenarios where this approach would fail\n4. What a thoughtful critic would say</p></div><p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;"><strong>Tip:</strong> This technique is uncomfortable but valuable. The goal is to strengthen your thinking, not change your mind.</p>'
      },
      reverse: {
        title: 'Reverse Prompting (Interview First)',
        content: '<p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Purpose:</strong> Get personalized advice by letting AI understand your context first.</p><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>When to use:</strong> Complex problems with many variables, when you\'re not sure what to ask, when generic advice won\'t help.</p><div style="background: #16162A; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #e2e8f0; white-space: pre-wrap;">I want to [goal], but I\'m not sure of the best approach.\n\nBefore giving advice, please interview me with 5-7 questions to understand my specific situation, constraints, and preferences.\n\nAsk one question at a time and wait for my response.</p></div><p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;"><strong>Tip:</strong> The back-and-forth conversation produces far better results than a single prompt.</p>'
      },
      stress: {
        title: 'Assessment Stress-Testing',
        content: '<p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Purpose:</strong> Discover whether your assessment actually measures what you think it does.</p><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>When to use:</strong> Designing new assessments, updating existing ones, checking for AI-vulnerability.</p><div style="background: #16162A; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #e2e8f0; white-space: pre-wrap;">I\'m designing a student assessment with these requirements:\n[paste assessment brief]\n\nPlease attempt this assessment as a student would, using AI. Then analyse:\n1. What skills does this actually assess?\n2. How could a student pass without demonstrating the intended learning?\n3. What would distinguish an excellent submission from a mediocre one?\n4. How should I redesign to better assess critical thinking?</p></div><p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;"><strong>Tip:</strong> If AI can easily complete your assessment, consider adding process documentation, in-class components, or personal application requirements.</p>'
      },
      chain: {
        title: 'Chain of Thought',
        content: '<p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Purpose:</strong> Get better reasoning on complex problems by asking AI to show its work.</p><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>When to use:</strong> Complex analysis, multi-step problems, when you need to verify AI\'s reasoning.</p><div style="background: #16162A; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #e2e8f0; white-space: pre-wrap;">[Your question or problem]\n\nPlease think through this step by step.\nShow your reasoning at each stage.</p></div><p style="margin: 0 0 15px 0; color: #CBD5E1;"><strong>Example:</strong></p><div style="background: #1E1E36; padding: 15px; border-radius: 6px; margin-bottom: 15px;"><p style="margin: 0; font-family: \'Courier New\', monospace; font-size: 0.9rem; color: #94A3B8;">Should our department require students to disclose AI use in assessments?\n\nPlease think through this step by step, considering:\n- The arguments for and against\n- Implementation challenges\n- What other institutions are doing\n- Your recommendation and reasoning</p></div><p style="margin: 0; color: #94A3B8; font-style: italic;"><strong>Tip:</strong> Chain of thought makes AI\'s reasoning transparent so you can check for flawed logic.</p>'
      },
      fewshot: {
        title: 'Few-Shot Learning',

  function loadLibrary() {
    var saved = localStorage.getItem('teaching-with-ai-library');

      var library = JSON.parse(saved);
      document.getElementById('library-task-1').value = library.task1 || '';

  window.exportLibrary = function() {
    var library = {
      task1: document.getElementById('library-task-1').value,
      prompt1: document.getElementById('library-prompt-1').value,
      task2: document.getElementById('library-task-2').value,
      prompt2: document.getElementById('library-prompt-2').value,
      task3: document.getElementById('library-task-3').value,
      prompt3: document.getElementById('library-prompt-3').value
    };

    var text = 'MY AI PROMPT LIBRARY\n';
    text += 'Working with AI - AI Skills Passport\n';
    text += '====================================\n\n';

    if (library.task1 || library.prompt1) {
      text += 'PROMPT 1: ' + (library.task1 || 'Untitled') + '\n';
      text += '----------------------------------------\n';
      text += library.prompt1 + '\n\n';
    }

    if (library.task2 || library.prompt2) {
      text += 'PROMPT 2: ' + (library.task2 || 'Untitled') + '\n';
      text += '----------------------------------------\n';
      text += library.prompt2 + '\n\n';
    }

    if (library.task3 || library.prompt3) {
      text += 'PROMPT 3: ' + (library.task3 || 'Untitled') + '\n';
      text += '----------------------------------------\n';
      text += library.prompt3 + '\n\n';
    }

    var blob = new Blob([text], { type: 'text/plain' });
    var url = URL.createObjectURL(blob);
    var a = document.createElement('a');
    a.href = url;
    a.download = 'my-ai-prompt-library.txt';
    a.click();
    URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
  };

  function saveToLocalStorage() {
    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    completions[experienceId] = {
      completedAt: new Date().toISOString(),
      uid: uid
    };
    localStorage.setItem('ai-passport-completions', JSON.stringify(completions));
  }

  function showCompletionSuccess() {
    document.getElementById('completion-trigger').style.display = 'none';
    document.getElementById('completion-section').style.display = 'block';

    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    var completedCount = Object.keys(completions).length;

    var badgeHtml = '';
    var nextBadge = null;

    for (var count in badges) {
      if (completedCount >= parseInt(count)) {
        badgeHtml += '<span style="font-size: 24px; margin: 0 4px;" title="' + badges[count].name + '">' + badges[count].emoji + '</span>';
      } else if (!nextBadge) {
        nextBadge = { count: parseInt(count), emoji: badges[count].emoji, name: badges[count].name };
      }
    }

    var progressText = '<div style="margin-bottom: 8px;">' + (badgeHtml || '<span style="color: #94A3B8;">Start your collection!</span>') + '</div>';
    progressText += '<p style="font-size: 13px; color: #64748B; margin: 0;">' + completedCount + ' experience' + (completedCount !== 1 ? 's' : '') + ' completed</p>';

    if (nextBadge) {
      progressText += '<p style="font-size: 12px; color: #94A3B8; margin: 4px 0 0 0;">Next badge: ' + nextBadge.emoji + ' ' + nextBadge.name + ' (' + (nextBadge.count - completedCount) + ' more)</p>';
    }

    document.getElementById('badge-progress').innerHTML = progressText;
  }

  function checkExistingCompletion() {
    var completions = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('ai-passport-completions') || '{}');
    if (completions[experienceId]) {
      document.getElementById('completion-trigger').innerHTML =
        '<div style="color: #22C55E; font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 8px;">&#10003;</div>' +
        '<p style="font-size: 14px; color: #64748B; margin: 0;">You completed this experience on ' + new Date(completions[experienceId].completedAt).toLocaleDateString() + '</p>';
    }
  }

  // ---- Add hover effects for technique cards ----
  function addHoverEffects() {
    var cards = document.querySelectorAll('.technique-card');
    for (var c = 0; c < cards.length; c++) {
      cards[c].addEventListener('mouseenter', function() {
        this.style.transform = 'translateY(-5px)';
        this.style.boxShadow = '0 10px 30px rgba(0,0,0,0.2)';
      });
      cards[c].addEventListener('mouseleave', function() {
        this.style.transform = 'translateY(0)';
        this.style.boxShadow = 'none';
      });
    }
  }

  // ---- Initialise ----
  loadStepProgress();
  renderProgressBar();
  showStep(currentStep);
  loadLibrary();
  addHoverEffects();
  checkExistingCompletion();
})();
</script>
